questions.question: The Phase 2 spec defines two automation paths: Architecture E (local cron + Max plan, $0/month) as primary and Architecture B (GitHub Actions + API key, $67-165/month) as fallback. What scope do you want for this implementation?

options.label: Both E and B
options.description: Build runner scripts for local cron AND GitHub Actions workflows as fallback. Full spec coverage.

options.label: Architecture E only
options.description: Local cron with runner scripts and monitoring. Skip GitHub Actions workflows for now — add later if needed.

options.label: Content first, automation later
options.description: Build agent files, rollup skills, and enhanced templates only. Defer all automation infrastructure (scripts, workflows, cron) to a separate step.

answers.The Phase 2 spec defines two automation: There has got to be a way to use my max plan on github actions. I see that claude code recently switched from npm install to a native installer. Does that change anything please do a round of deep research to figure out how we can automate the system ongithub actions using our max plan.

data.response: I now have a thorough understanding of the entire Phase 2 scope. Before writing the final plan, I need to clarify one architectural decision.
